runaway_electrons/profiles_1d/grid/rho_t.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: runaway_electrons/profiles_1d/grid/rho_tor_norm
IDS: runaway_electrons
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 3
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 4
PARENT_CONTAINER: runaway_electrons/profiles_1d/grid
FIELD_NAME: rho_tor_norm
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: runaway_electrons -> profiles_1d -> grid -> rho_tor_norm

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Normalized toroidal flux coordinate. The normalizing value for rho_tor_norm, is the toroidal flux coordinate at the equilibrium boundary (LCFS or 99.x % of the LCFS in case of a fixed boundary equilibium calculation, see time_slice/boundary/b_flux_pol_norm in the equilibrium IDS) 

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[runaway_electrons]: Description of runaway electrons
CONTAINER[runaway_electrons/profiles_1d]: Radial flux surface averaged profiles for a set of time slices
CONTAINER[runaway_electrons/profiles_1d/grid]: Radial grid

=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: runaway_electrons/profiles_1d/grid/rho_tor
IDS: runaway_electrons
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 3
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 4
PARENT_CONTAINER: runaway_electrons/profiles_1d/grid
FIELD_NAME: rho_tor
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: runaway_electrons -> profiles_1d -> grid -> rho_tor

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Toroidal flux coordinate = sqrt(phi/(pi*b0)), where the toroidal magnetic field, b0, corresponds to that stored in vacuum_toroidal_field/b0 and pi can be found in the IMAS constants

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[runaway_electrons]: Description of runaway electrons
CONTAINER[runaway_electrons/profiles_1d]: Radial flux surface averaged profiles for a set of time slices
CONTAINER[runaway_electrons/profiles_1d/grid]: Radial grid

runaway_electrons/profiles_1d/grid/rho_p.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: runaway_electrons/profiles_1d/grid/rho_pol_norm
IDS: runaway_electrons
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 3
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 4
PARENT_CONTAINER: runaway_electrons/profiles_1d/grid
FIELD_NAME: rho_pol_norm
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: runaway_electrons -> profiles_1d -> grid -> rho_pol_norm

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Normalized poloidal flux coordinate = sqrt((psi(rho)-psi(magnetic_axis)) / (psi(LCFS)-psi(magnetic_axis)))

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[runaway_electrons]: Description of runaway electrons
CONTAINER[runaway_electrons/profiles_1d]: Radial flux surface averaged profiles for a set of time slices
CONTAINER[runaway_electrons/profiles_1d/grid]: Radial grid

runaway_electrons/profiles_1d/grid/psi.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: runaway_electrons/profiles_1d/grid/psi
IDS: runaway_electrons
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 3
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 4
PARENT_CONTAINER: runaway_electrons/profiles_1d/grid
FIELD_NAME: psi
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: runaway_electrons -> profiles_1d -> grid -> psi

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Poloidal magnetic flux. Integral of magnetic field passing through a contour defined by the intersection of a flux surface passing through the point of interest and a Z=constant plane. If the integration surface is flat, the surface normal vector is in the increasing vertical coordinate direction, Z, namely upwards.

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[runaway_electrons]: Description of runaway electrons
CONTAINER[runaway_electrons/profiles_1d]: Radial flux surface averaged profiles for a set of time slices
CONTAINER[runaway_electrons/profiles_1d/grid]: Radial grid

runaway_electrons/distribution/markers/o.documentation:
=== IMAS DATA DICTIONARY ENTRY ===
FULL_PATH: runaway_electrons/distribution/markers/orbit_integrals
IDS: runaway_electrons
HIERARCHY_DEPTH: 3
TOTAL_CONTEXT_LEVELS: 4
PARENT_CONTAINER: runaway_electrons/distribution/markers
FIELD_NAME: orbit_integrals
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: runaway_electrons -> distribution -> markers -> orbit_integrals

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Integrals along the markers orbit. These dimensionless expressions are of the form: (1/tau) integral (f(n_tor,m_pol,k,eq,...) dt) from time - tau to time, where tau is the transit/trapping time of the marker and f() a dimensionless function (phase factor,drift,etc) of the equilibrium (e.g. q) and perturbation (Fourier harmonics n_tor,m_pol and bounce harmonic k) along the particles orbits. In fact the integrals are taken during the last orbit of each marker at the time value of the time node below

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[runaway_electrons]: Description of runaway electrons
CONTAINER[runaway_electrons/distribution]: Distribution function of the runaway electrons
CONTAINER[runaway_electrons/distribution/markers]: Distribution represented by a set of markers (test particles)

CONTAINER[runaway_electrons/distribution/markers/orbit_integrals]: Integrals along the markers orbit. These dimensionless expressions are of the form: (1/tau) integral (f(n_tor,m_pol,k,eq,...) dt) from time - tau to time, where tau is the transit/trapping time of the marker and f() a dimensionless function (phase factor,drift,etc) of the equilibrium (e.g. q) and perturbation (Fourier harmonics n_tor,m_pol and bounce harmonic k) along the particles orbits. In fact the integrals are taken during the last orbit of each marker at the time value of the time node below

IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: runaway_electrons -> distribution -> markers -> orbit_integrals -> n_phi

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Array of toroidal mode numbers, where quantities vary as exp(i.n_phi.phi) and phi runs anticlockwise when viewed from above

=== CONTEXTUAL HIERARCHY ===
ROOT_IDS[runaway_electrons]: Description of runaway electrons
CONTAINER[runaway_electrons/distribution]: Distribution function of the runaway electrons
CONTAINER[runaway_electrons/distribution/markers]: Distribution represented by a set of markers (test particles)
CONTAINER[runaway_electrons/distribution/markers/orbit_integrals]: Integrals along the markers orbit. These dimensionless expressions are of the form: (1/tau) integral (f(n_tor,m_pol,k,eq,...) dt) from time - tau to time, where tau is the transit/trapping time of the marker and f() a dimensionless function (phase factor,drift,etc) of the equilibrium (e.g. q) and perturbation (Fourier harmonics n_tor,m_pol and bounce harmonic k) along the particles orbits. In fact the integrals are taken during the last orbit of each marker at the time value of the time node below

FIELD_NAME: m_pol
IS_LEAF_FIELD: True
PATH_COMPONENTS: runaway_electrons -> distribution -> markers -> orbit_integrals -> m_pol

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Array of poloidal mode numbers, where quantities vary as exp(-i.m_pol.theta) and theta is the angle defined by the choice of ../../coordinate_identifier, with its centre at the magnetic axis recalled at the root of this IDS

PRIMARY_DESCRIPTION: Integrals/quantities along the markers orbit. These dimensionless expressions are of the form: (1/tau) integral ( f(eq) dt) from time - tau to time_orbit for different values of time_orbit in the interval from time - tau to time, where tau is the transit/trapping time of the marker and f(eq) a dimensionless function (phase, drift,q,etc) of the equilibrium along the markers orbits. The integrals are taken during the last orbit of each marker at the time value of the time node below
